page.title: 02MICHAELCHURCH ESCLEY SCHOOL
page.content: {Michaelchurch Escley C.P.School}is probably the most isolated school in {Hereford-Worcester.}From its site no other houses can be seen.The present building,consisting of 2 classrooms and a converted school house,now holding an office,staff room,artroom, and library/computer room,was built in 1939 after the original structure was destroyed by fire. In{1985}there are{40 pupils}on roll. The school is staffed by a Headmaster, Assistant teacher,secretary/ancillary and a caretaker. The{annual capitation}for 1985-86 is{Â£2126.}Other money is available through the School Fund and P.T.A. The school has a playground,garden and playing fields.There is also a fenced Nature area with a pond and small coppice.
